{{Infobox Embedded System |image1 = DIR-620 C1 Fr (1).jpg |image1_size = 150px |caption = Wireless N Router |caption2 = |pp = |sp = |dl = |wikidevi = D-Link_DIR-620_rev_C1 |wikipedia = |ddwrtsupport = |openwrtsupport = |tomatosupport = |gargoylesupport = |brand = D-Link |model = DIR-620 |submodelappend = |submodel = |revision = S/C1 |subrevision = |model_part_num = |page_start_date = |page_start_origon = |wlclass = N300 |series = DIR-620 |type = wireless router |sernum = |fcc_id = |icid = |us_id = |boardid = |ecc_id = |cpu1chip1 = Broadcom;BCM5358UB0; |cpu1_cores = 1 |cpu1_type = MIPS 74K |cpu1_type_rev = |cpu1spd = 530 |is_doc = |bus = |flash1type = |fla1_num = |fla1chip = Macronix;MX25L6406EM2I-12G; |flash1size = 8 |flash1maxsize = |ram1type = |ram1type1 = |ram1spd = |ram1size = 64 |ram1chip = EtronTech;EM6AB160TSD-5G; |ram1_num = |nvramsize = |eth_cpu = true |sw_cpu = true |wan_ports = 1 |wan_speed = 100MbE |lan_ports = 4 |lan_speed = 100MbE |ethstandard = |portbasedvlan = |802.1qvlan = |auto_mdix = |sup_jumbo = |ethoui = |oui = |bootwait = |stockbootloader = |stockos = |exp_if_types = USB 2.0 |exp_usb_num = 1 |usb_hub = |pwr_volt_type = VDC |pwr_vdc = 12 |pwr_amp_dc = 1 |pwr_conn = barrel |pwr_barrel_outer = |pwr_barrel_inner = |pwr_barrel_len = |pwr_pol = |serial = yes,, internal,, 4-pin header,, unpopulated |jtag = |specialfeat = |flags = |addchip = |802dot11_protocols = bgn |defaulip = 192.168.0.1 |defaultlogin = admin |defaultpass = admin |defaultssid = |defaultssid_regex = |default_ch = |manuf = |manuf_model = |manuf_rev = |is_manuf = No |tpfirmware = Vampik, FreshTomato |availability = |eoldate = |fccapprovdate = |estreldate = |estprice = |upc = |ean = |dx_sku = |newegg = |asin = |asin_country = |asin2 = |asin_country2 = |countrymanuf = China |buttons = |led = |dimensions = |weight = |wi1_if_name = |rad1chip1cpu = true |rad1oui = |rad1_ant_conn = |rad1txchains = 2 |rad1rxchains = 2 |rad1sstreams = 2 |rad1stand = IEEE 802.11b/g/n |rad1n = 300 |rad1g = 54 |rad1b = 11 |rad1freq = 2.4 |rad1correv = |rad1cap = }}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== This device shares the same board as the [[D-Link DIR-615 rev K2]], but the USB portion is populated on this model. This device is presumably sold mainly (only?) in Russia and Ukraine. Support firmware by [http://vampik.ru/2013/04/02/testovaya-versiya-proshivki-dlya-d-link-dir-620-rev-c1/ Vampik] FW: [http://vampik.ru/wl500g/rtn/5010/DIR620C1-3.0.5-r5010M.trx DIR620C1-3.0.5-r5010M] :Simple flash from web interface of D-Link stock firmware. See also [[D-Link DIR-620]].. ==Pictures==
'''Retail Images''' File:DIR-620 C1 Fr (1).jpg|Front File:DIR-620 C1 Bk (2).jpg|Back
[[Has images::retail| ]]
'''User Images''' File:Dual-dir-620.JPG|Dual DIR-620 A1 and C1 File:Dual-dir-620_back.JPG|DIR-620 A1 and C1 back [[Has images::external| ]] File:Dir615k2.jpg|DIR-615 K2 board File:D-Link DIR-620 C1 board top shieldon.JPG|board top, shield on File:D-Link DIR-620 C1 board top.JPG|board top, shield off File:DIR-620 C1 CPU.JPG|CPU File:DIR-620 C1 RAM.JPG|RAM File:DIR-620 C1 FLA.JPG|Flash
[[Has images::internal| ]] ==Notes== ===Console dumps=== 
$ cat /proc/mtd
dev:    size   erasesize  name
mtd0: 00020000 00010000 "boot"
mtd1: 007c0000 00010000 "Linux"
mtd2: 0068137c 00010000 "rootfs"
mtd3: 00010000 00010000 "rgdb"
mtd4: 00010000 00010000 "nvram"
mtd5: 00800000 00010000 "all"
after flash Oleg`s firmware 
root]$ cat /proc/mtd
dev:    size   erasesize  name
mtd0: 00020000 00010000 "boot"
mtd1: 007d0000 00010000 "linux"
mtd2: 006c6588 00010000 "rootfs"
mtd3: 00010000 00010000 "nvram"
mtd4: 00240000 00010000 "flashfs"
and cpuinfo 
root]$ cat /proc/cpuinfo
system type             : Broadcom BCM5357 chip rev 2 pkg 8
processor               : 0
cpu model               : MIPS 74K V4.9
BogoMIPS                : 264.19
wait instruction        : no
microsecond timers      : yes
tlb_entries             : 64
extra interrupt vector  : no
hardware watchpoint     : yes
ASEs implemented        : mips16 dsp
shadow register sets    : 1
VCED exceptions         : not available
VCEI exceptions         : not available
frequency 530Mhz 
$ nvram show | grep clkfreq
size: 17883 bytes (14885 left)
clkfreq=530,176,88
 [[Category:English Documentation]]
